results.title: Gorky Park
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Eagle Associates, Gene Kirkwood, Howard W. Koch and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: Relentlessly thrilling from its shocking beginning to its spine-chilling end. William Hurt is a Russian Police Inspector investigating a ruthless triple murder in Moscow’s Gorky Park. The victims’ faces and fingers are missing and the KGB is trying to cover it up. Stars Lee Marvin, Brian Dennehy, Ian Bannen and introducing Joanna Pacula. Filmed entirely in Helsinki. The screenplay by Dennis Potter is based upon the novel by Martin Cruz Smith.

results.title: Goodbye pork pie
results.creator_credit: Pork Pie Productions, New Zealand Film Commission, Nigel Hutchinson and Geoff Murphy
results.brief_description: An anarchic comedy chase road move which deftly gets its three travellers on the road in a fraudulently hired Mini. They become known as the Blondini Gang as they are pursued the length of the country by the police, coming into contact with a range of eccentrics along the way. This was the first New Zealand film to recover its costs from the domestic market alone. Its popularity changed New Zealanders’ reluctance to watch locally made movies. Writers, Geoff Murphy, Ian Mune ; photography, Alun Bollinger.

results.title: Goodbye Mr Chips!
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Victor Saville, Sam Wood and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: This film of timeless quality is more than just entertainment. Chip’s life is one lived fully. Although many feel that he has been denied a lot in a lonely life, his recollections prove the contrary. Exquisitely woven into his memories are his unexpected romance with Elizabeth and what their love means to him. Considered either as an adaptation of James Hilton’s short novel or as a film per se, “Goodbye Mr Chips” is a considerable achievement for 1939. Sam Wood (King’s Row) directed the film for MGM and and Victor Saville produced it in England shortly before World War II. It stars Robert Donat and Greer Garson. Rated: G

results.title: Goodbye Lenin
results.creator_credit: X-Filme Creative Pool, GmbH, Arte, Stefan Arndt and Wolfgang Becker
results.brief_description: Political satire set in East Berlin circa 1990 “Goodbye Lenin” is a surprisingly light-hearted examination of life under Communist rule seen through the prism of one family. Just prior to the fall of the Berlin wall single mother Christiane falls into a coma, oblivious to the revolution of her beloved homeland. Fearing the shock of the uprising may hamper his mother’s recovery, twenty-something Alex sets up an elaborate ruse in which he convinces her that the East has triumphed over the West. Working from this absurd premise director Wolfgang Becker deftly crafts a poignant and bittersweet work that at heart is a coming of age journey for Alex. Cast includes: Daniel Bruhl.

results.title: Good Will Hunting (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Lawrence Bender and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: Will Hunting (Matt Damon) is a janitor from working-class South Boston, but he is in fact a genius. Abused as a child, he has been in trouble with the law ever since, and is finally facing a jail sentence. In order to save his relationship with his girlfriend (Minnie Driver), and to stay out of jail, Will agrees to receive counselling. With his therapist Sean (Robin Williams), he starts to transform his life. This is the poignant story of both Will and Sean coming to terms with the blows life has dealt them, and the unknown future. Cast includes Ben Affleck, who features as Will’s best friend, and Casey Affleck. (Awards: Academy Awards, Robin Williams for Best Supporting Actor, and Matt Damon/Ben Affleck for Best Screenplay)

results.title: Gone with the wind
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Selznick International, David O. Selznick and Victor Fleming
results.brief_description: This landmark film, based on Margaret Mitchell’s mammoth novel, won eight Academy Awards. The siege of Atlanta and the hardships of the South during the Civil War are masterfully unfolded in this terrific spectacle. Vivien Leigh’s performance as the headstrong Scarlett O’Hara is magical, and Clark Gable makes the ladies’ hearts flutter as Rhett Butler. Supported by Olivia de Havilland and Leslie Howard, the stars make this part spectacle, part history an epic entertainment.

results.title: Gone in 60 seconds = Gone in sixty seconds
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Jerry Bruckheimer, Mike Stenson and Dominic Sena
results.brief_description: In this remake of H. B. Halicki’s cult favourite, Nicholas Cage stars as Randall “Memphis” Raines, a master car thief whose desire to get out of the game is compromised when his brother becomes embroiled with a dangerous criminal. To save his brother Memphis must steal fifty cars in one evening, a task he undertakes with the aid of a motley crew. At the same time, another gang is undertaking the same challenge and the police are hot on the trail of both. Cast also includes Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi, Will Patton, Robert Duvall.

results.title: Gone in 60 seconds = Gone in sixty seconds
results.creator_credit: H B Halicki Mercantile Co, Junk Yard and H.B. Halicki
results.brief_description: Sixty seconds is all it takes for professional car thief Maindrian Pace (H.B. Halicki, who also wrote, produced and directed) to steal a car, and he’s in the perfect position to fuel his habit - working for an insurance adjustment firm. With a script boasting real life stunt drivers who also happen to be associates of Halicki, this film features a 40 minute Mustang car chase sequence where it is reported that over 93 cars were destroyed. The film received mixed reviews, however it also received a cult following from those amongst the community who like mustangs, car chases, the seventies and a stunt co-ordinator let loose with a film camera.

results.title: Gold diggers Of 1933
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Robert Lord, Jack L. Warner, Mervyn LeRoy and Busby Berkeley
results.brief_description: Dick Powell and Ruby Keeler play two young hopefuls struggling to make it on Broadway. Even falling in love has its hardships, as Powell’s high-brow Eastern family is determined to break them (and the show) up. More complications set in when his brother falls for Keeler’s wise-cracking roommate. Cast also includes Warren William, Joan blondell, Ginger Rogers. Based on a play by Avery Hopwood. Musical numbers created and directed by Busby Berkeley.
